chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Theodore L. Mitchell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess any illegal drugs, substances or drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
Defendant shall not go upon any premises where he believes Chapter 961 contraband may be present.
Defendant shall not associate with any individuals who may possess or use illegal substances.
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless authorized by MVD.
Defendant shall have no contact directly or indirectly with Theodore Mitchell Sr., unless approved in writing by Agent.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Provide biological specimen to State Crime Lab for DNA analysis.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall possess prescription medication only by valid prescription and take in the manner and method as prescribed by physician.
Defendant shall report all medical appointments and medication changes to Agent within 72 hours.
Defendant must use one pharmacy for prescription needs.

records.addlTxt: elements

Defendant Theodore L. Mitchell in court with attorney Troy L. Nielsen. 
John P. Snider appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
13CF226 - No contest plea to Counts 1 & 3. Counts 2 & 4 are dismissed and read in. 
13CF228 - No contest plea to Count 1. 
13CM307 - No contest plea to Counts 1 - 7. Counts 8 - 15 are dismissed and read in. 
14CF118 - No contest plea to Counts 2 & 4. Counts 1, 3 & 5 are dismissed and read in. 
14CF337 - No contest plea to Count 2. Count 1 is dismissed and read in. 
PLQ filed with the Court on all cases. 
Defendant acknowleges prior conviction. 
Pleas accepted after rights explained and defendant is found guilty.
State is in compliance with victim notifications. 
Recommendations by counsel. 
Statements by defendant. 
Sentence withheld, 3 years Probation ordered on all files/counts. 
Conditions: 
- pay costs, DOMAB on 14CF118, 13CM307, 13CF226, DRGOD on 13CF226
- pay supervision fees
- submit to assessment/counseling and abide by recommendations 
- not possess any illegal drugs, substances or paraphernalia as defined in Ch. 961
- not go upon any premises where they believe Ch. 961 contraband may be present 
- not operate a motor vehicle unless authorized by DMV
- possess prescription medication only by valid prescription and take in the manner and method as prescribed by physician, and report all medical appointments and medication changes to Agent within 72 hours 
- no contact directly or indirectly with Theodore Mitchell Sr. unless approved in writing by Agent 
- must use one pharmacy for all prescription needs 
- provide DNA sample on all CF files 
- 6 months jail, stayed, to be used at Agent's discretion on 14CF118 Count 4 
- not associate with any individuals who may possess or use illegal substances
Firearm, voting and appeal rights explained. 
The Court granted sentence credit if revoked as:
13CF226 - 1 day
13CF228 - 1 day
13CM307 - 1 day
14CF118 - 2 days
